Detailed Description

Optimize a sigmoid after SVM outputs to turn them into probability estimates.

The optSigmoidFit class implements a non-iterative optimizer. It optimizes a sigmoid to fit the posterior probability for positive class given SVM outputs. Although the optimizer is iterative in its nature, it is more convenient to implement it in one single step. As a side effect, Platt's original and very heuristic stopping conditions are kept.
The method was presented by John Platt in 1999, see
Probabilistic Outputs for Support Vector Machines and Comparisons to Regularized Likelyhood Methods, Advances in Large Margin Classifiers, pp. 61-74, MIT Press, (1999).
The full paper can be downloaded from
http://www.research.microsoft.com/~jplatt
--- pseudo-code is given in the paper.

Don't call the optimize member more than once, as the optSigmoidFit optimizer is not iterative.

Parameters:
model reference to the SigmoidModel object to train
errorfunction unused - can be set to SVM::dummyError.
